name: Yogurt Chutney
history: Yogurt Chutney, also known as Dahi Chutney, is a common accompaniment in Indian cuisine. This chutney is a blend of yogurt with herbs and spices, offering a cool and refreshing flavor. It's often served with biryanis, kebabs, and various snacks.
description: Yogurt Chutney is a creamy and flavorful condiment made with yogurt, mint, coriander, and a blend of spices. It's known for its cooling properties and is perfect for balancing the heat of spicy dishes.

instructions.title: Blend Ingredients
instructions.description: In a blender or food processor, combine yogurt, mint leaves, coriander leaves, green chili, cumin powder, chaat masala, salt, and sugar. Blend until smooth.

instructions.title: Adjust Consistency
instructions.description: If the chutney is too thick, add a little water and blend again to achieve the desired consistency.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Yogurt Chutney chilled with snacks like tikkas, kebabs, or as a side with biryanis.

tips: Use fresh herbs for the best flavor.
Adjust the amount of green chili according to your spice preference.
variations: Add a small piece of ginger for an extra zing.
Include a spoonful of roasted peanut powder for a nutty flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Yogurt Chutney is best served cold and does not require reheating.

presentationTips: Serve in a small bowl with a mint leaf garnish.
Pair with a colorful array of snacks for a visually appealing presentation.
